metadata.title: CVE-2020-24490 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Improper buffer restrictions in BlueZ may allow an unauthenticated user topotentially enable denial of service via adjacent access. This affects allLinux kernel versions that support BlueZ.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24490` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16

linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-122-generic - 4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1
